summary: Email correspondence between a Courtroom Deputy for Judge Sarah Netburn and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al. The AUSA provides a Word version of a sealed order for unsealing in the case.

persons.name: Sarah Netburn
persons.context: Judge Netburn is the presiding judge in the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al., and her courtroom deputy is requesting a document on her behalf.

persons.name: Jane Doe 43
persons.context: Jane Doe 43 is the plaintiff in the civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein and others, referenced by the case number 17 Civ. 616 (JGK)(SN).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is a named defendant in the civil lawsuit Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.

connections.description: Jane Doe 43 is the plaintiff suing Jeffrey Epstein in a civil case, indicating an alleged victim-perpetrator relationship.

events.title: Email Request for Sealed Order
events.description: Courtroom Deputy for Judge Sarah Netburn emails an Assistant U.S. Attorney requesting a Word version of a sealed order in the case Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al., for unsealing purposes.

locations.context: Location of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, where Judge Sarah Netburn's courtroom deputy is based.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Federal judicial district where the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al. is being litigated.

keyFacts: The document is an email regarding the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al., case number 17 Civ. 616 (JGK)(SN).
Judge Sarah Netburn's courtroom deputy is requesting a Word version of a sealed order from an Assistant U.S. Attorney for unsealing.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney provides the requested document, indicating cooperation between the court and prosecution in the case.
The case involves Jane Doe 43 as a plaintiff against Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting ongoing civil litigation related to Epstein's conduct.
